entry.title: The Overlook (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Alexander McQueen collection The Overlook (Autumn/Winter 1999) featured a Shaun Leane–produced corset made from coiled aluminium (pictured)?

entry.title: a law banning Native Americans from living in Seattle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a law banning Native Americans from living in Seattle was voided when Seattle itself was abolished?

entry.title: Cam McCormick (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cam McCormick is thought to be the first college football player to be granted a ninth year of NCAA eligibility?

entry.title: the oldest surviving synagogue building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the oldest surviving synagogue building in Wisconsin was almost razed in the 1970s?

entry.title: August Palmisano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when tavern operator August Palmisano was killed in a 1978 car bombing, authorities suspected organized crime in Milwaukee?

entry.title: myNoise (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the COVID-19 pandemic, some former office workers used myNoise to remind them of their workplace?

entry.title: Charles J. Turck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Charles J. Turck was accused of being a communist spy during his time as president of Macalester College?

entry.title: The Waste Land (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Waste Land, considered one of the most important poems of the 20th century, was described as "waste paper" when first published?
